args: You open? 'Cause I could go for some\nfried buns.
Yeah, we's open. 'Ow many you want?
Why the long face, brother?\nBusiness not quite booming?
'S my regular face, thanks.\nAnd I get by just fine.

Funny you should say that. 'Cause from
where I'm standing, you look like a guy
who just lost a heretical grimoire and
a big payday along with it.
Wha—?! Who the hell are you?
Me? Just a happy festival-goer. One who's\nabsolutely rocking this yukata, I might add.
Funny how guys like you are much more\nopen to chatting with someone in this\noutfit over, say, a set of inquisitor's robes.

Woof woof. Funny thing about dogs—
their teeth really have a way of sinking
into flesh. And unfortunately for you,
I seem to have forgotten my muzzle.
Maybe my thinly veiled metaphor didn't\nmake it clear enough: you're not going\nANYWHERE, pal.
Listening comprehension isn't\nyour strong suit, I see.
Tell you what. You give me the lowdown\non what's in this bag, and I give you the\nVIP treatment from here on out.
That's—! How'd one of Ilia's mutts get his\npaws on it? Lady Luck's spat in our eye...
Sounds like a rough date. The gal I serve\nis a real class act. She's all smiles for me.
Yeah! Thank you, Curran.\nI'm so relieved.
But...how did you know it would be here?
The bag you were carrying had a copy\nof the Liber Grimortis in it, right?
You said it yourself: even if it's just a copy,\nit's important enough that you wouldn't go\nshowing it off willy-nilly. With me so far?
What I'm saying is. I doubt the owner was\ncarrying it around just for fun.
A festival is probably the last place you'd\nwant to bring something so illicit, right?\nThat is, unless you had a reason.
So you think they did it on purpose?
Bingo. Every part of this was planned.
Odds are good the whole switcheroo\nwith your purse while Melanie had it\nwas intentional, too.
That's the kicker. They never meant to\ntrade bags with HER.
Mr. Fried Buns was planning to make the\nswap for the Liber Grimortis with someone.
Not as an accident, but a deal.
A guy sets his bag down real casual-like,\nand it gets swapped for an identical one.\nThat's Illicit Trading 101.
So because Melanie set my bag down\nwhile she was catching goldfish—
Yup. It got mistaken for their client's.\nThe perp took it and ran.
No reason to stick around frying bread\nonce the deal's done and dusted.
So he closed up shop early and took off.
And then he came back because...
Because he took one look inside the bag\nand realized he'd botched the exchange.
Bet he was sweating bullets. No doubt\nhe was expecting a tidy sum for a book\nthat rare...
...but upon opening the bag, blammo.\nNo gold. No jewels. No nothin'.
Why, what have you got in there?\nAh, rock candy?
It's so sparkly—like jewels. I thought it\nwas really pretty, so, um... I bought you\nsome, Curran.
You sure you don't want to enjoy\nyour pretty candy yourself?
Positive. I thought it would be a small\nway of repaying you for always being so\nnice to me.
I was so upset when I thought it was lost.
Aha. So that's why you were so hung up\non getting your specific bag back.
Boy, whoever said that thing about beauty\nonly being skin deep must've been blind.
Your heart shines bright like a diamond,\nkiddo. You're a one-of-a-kind soul.
Hee hee. You got the line out\nwithout tripping over the words.
Pfft. Let me tell you something, little lady.\nWhen a guy's gotta rise to the occlusion,\nhe cakes it mount!
Heinwald. Haven't seen your ugly\nmug in a minute. How's tricks?

Blissfully quiet without your interjections.
Would that I could always pursue my work
so single-mindedly! Now, what is this I
hear about your most recent caper, hm?

Something about you busting a ring
of heretics at a summer festival?
They say you single-handedly foiled
a most dastardly scheme.
Yeah, well, ＂they＂ exaggerated. And? \nSurely you didn't come all this way just\nto give me a friendly pat on the back.

This same little bird told me you chanced
upon a copy of the Liber Grimortis along
the way. I don't suppose I could sweet-talk
you into letting me have it...?
You're talking about key evidence, pal.\nI can't just hand it out like a door prize.
Besides, I thought you already read the\noriginal Liber-whatsit. What do you want\nwith some copy?
Ah, but it is precisely BECAUSE it is\na copy that I find myself so intrigued.
Some copies of the Liber Grimortis\ncontain new theories not found in the\noriginal manuscript.

Some accounts say that reading the tome
will awaken some untold horror. Others,
that the text brings truth into relief with a
certain mad clarity... A delicious thought.
Yum. I can almost taste the blasphemy.\nWell, you might be able to twist my arm.\n...In exchange for intel on other heretics.
What a peculiar proposition. Just what sort\nof information do you presume I possess?
Hah. I'm not blind, Heinwald. I know you\nwere the original buyer for the grimoire\nthat day.
I also know you were the one who hired\nDominic and the thugs who tried to nab\nLathna's bag.
My, my... Quite the fanciful theory. I would\nbe curious to know what sort of foundation\nyou're basing these allegations upon.
This mysterious employer sent two—\ncount 'em, two—grown men to snatch\na purse from Lathna.
Most folks wouldn't waste good coin hiring\nmuscle to shake down a defenseless girl.\nYou'd just do it yourself.
There are plenty of people in this world\nwith reputations to uphold. Perhaps they\npreferred to keep their hands clean?
Then they'd hire a single thug.\nThis employer opted for two.
Because he knew that if they made\none wrong move, that ＂little girl＂\nwould become a real big problem.
What's more, these thugs knew her.\nName, face, the whole shebang.
So we have someone with an interest in\ngrimoires, no misgivings about dealing\nwith heretics, and familiarity with Lathna.
Narrows the list down to about...one, no?
A truly breathtaking display of conjecture.\nYou would suspect me on such flimsy\ngrounds?
You want proof, try this one on for size:\nthe fact that you're here says everything.
I haven't told a soul that I found a\ncopy of the Liber Grimortis in that bag.
So, tell me about this ＂little bird＂ of yours.\nAnd don't try to say it was Lathna.
Hm. I am mortified to have overlooked\nsuch a glaring detail. But very well.\nYou win this round.
—Is what I would say if I were a witless\ndove caught in the birdlime of your puerile\nreasoning. I was obviously aware, Curran.
I wanted to ask your assistance with those\nvery heretics, which is why I've given up on\nthe tome and approached you directly.
That's...odd. Must be quite the case\nif you're willingly coming to me.
Yes, I suppose it is. Well? What say you,\npartner? If you're enticed, then let's be off.
Heh. Wouldn't miss it\nfor the world, partner.
